chapter.title: Performance and Scalability
chapter.para: Performance and scalability are two different but related qualities (see ). Performance is the amount of useful work accomplished in a some period of time. Scalability is the ability to handle a growing amount of work over time. Performance is about how long a single activity takes; scalability is about how long an activity takes as more and more work is performed by the system.
As we saw before, scalability is one of the raisons d'etre of REST. This chapter delves into the things you can do to ensure good performance and scalability.

section.title: Caching
section.para: Responses with the following status codes are cacheable by default: 200, 203, 204, 206, 300, 301, 404, 405, 410, 414, and 501.
